search_results.snippet: Perimeter is 1-dimensional and is measured in linear units such as inches, feet or meters. Area is 2-dimensional: it has a length and a width. Area is measured in square units such as square inches, square feet or square meters. To find the area of a rectangle, multiply the length by the width.

from the Greek peri (around) and meter (measure). The term may be used either 
for the path or its length&endash;it can be thought of as the length of the outline

perimeter of a polygon equals the sum of the lengths of its sides (edges).
